text: Elizaveta Esperovna Elizabeth Trubetskaya (1834-1907), was a Russian Princess and salonist, by birth member of Belosselsky-Belozersky family. She hosted a famous literary salon in Paris during the Second Empire, and played a crucial part as a mediator when France and Russia established their diplomatic contacts in the 1870s.А. З. Манфред. Очерки истории Франции XVIII—XX вв. Изд- во Академии наук СССР, 1961. Стр. 299. She was grandmother of Princess Aurora Pavlovna Demidova di San Donato, great-grandmother of Prince Regent Paul of Yugoslavia and thus ancestor of Prince Alexander of Yugoslavia, Princess Elizabeth of Yugoslavia, actress Catherine Oxenberg and writer Christina Oxenberg. == References == Category:1834 births Category:1907 deaths Category:19th-century Russian people Category:Russian ladies-in-waiting Category:Russian salon-holders
title: Elizabeth Trubetskaya
